page.description: Return the reference expression to reconstruct a reference to the object.
page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.REFERENCE_EXPRESSION_GET() Syntax Expression as C = &ltOBJECT>.REFERENCE_EXPRESSION_GET() Description The &ltOBJECT>.REFERENCE_EXPRESSION_GET() method applies to:
Alpha Anywhere (for &ltOBJECT> use the keyword "A5")
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form)
Form Controls (for &ltOBJECT> use the &ltCONTROL> pointer or the address of the control) The &ltOBJECT>.REFERENCE_EXPRESSION_GET() method returns the expression required to reconstruct a reference to the object. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example dim ptr as P ptr = form.load("Travel Time") ? ptr.name() ? "Travel_Time" ? ptr.Reference_Expression_Get() = ":Travel_Time.this"
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
